Task.nme: Unlock Phone: Not Used: Phone Lock Status

Share.d:
Here you have a little task that will help you to get more information than the 'KEYG' built-in variable, about the device lock status.
Quick information: • Device Locked: The device is locked and asks for authentication in order to use it. • Device Secure: The device is protected (service), regardless of if the protection mechanism is not currently required to use the device. • Keyguard Locked: The device is locked and doesn't ask for authentication in order to use it. • Keyguard Secure: The Lockscreen is enabled (service), regardless of if the device is locked or not.
The Device/Keyguard Locked represents the current state of the device, and Device/Keyguard Secure represents the general configuration of the device.

Action.label:
Device Locked: The device is locked and asks for authentication in order to use it.

Device Secure: The device is protected (service), regardless of if the protection mechanism is not currently required to use the device.

Keyguard Locked: The device is locked and doesn't ask for authentication in order to use it.

Keyguard Secure: The Lockscreen is enabled (service), regardless of if the device is locked or not.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

The Device/Keyguard Locked represents the current state of the device, and Device/Keyguard Secure represents the general configuration of the device.

Vals.com.twofortyfouram.locale.intent.extra.B: Screen Off Or On: Turn On
Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%err Error Code Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%errmsg Error Message Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1></StringArray>

Action.label: Show overview and store whether the user indicated they have AutoInput.

Open AutoInput, if they don't have it.
Offer to test unlocking the phone, if they do.

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
The next dialogs will help you set the variables needed to enable Tasker to unlock your phone.
If you want to run this installer again, simply re-enable the installer's profile.
IMPORTANT! You need to install and purchase AutoInput for this to work! If you do not currently have this Tasker plugin, click "I do NOT have AutoInput" and the Google Play store will open when setup is complete.

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str: Which direction do you swipe to unlock your phone?

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Do you click a checkmark after entering your PIN?
If you do not use a lock screen or only have to swipe to unlock your phone, choose "No".

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%pin_value Input The text that was inserted in the dialog</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str:
Please enter the PIN used to unlock your phone. Your PIN is only stored locally. This project does not export any data. (I don't even know if that's possible, and I've never tried.)
If you do not use a PIN, click "Cancel".
NOTE: Clicking "Cancel" will clear the value of the global variable "Password" if one is already set!

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%td_button Button The label of the button that was clicked</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0></StringArray>

Action.Str: Do you want to test unlocking your phone?

Share.d: Enter a 4 digit PIN from the PIN entry screen that appears after swiping on the lock screen.

Action.label: We don't actually care about %dvc_locked because %kg_locked is what we actually need. Retaining %dvc_locked in case we need it in the future.

Vals.com.twofortyfouram.locale.intent.extra.B: Type: Id Value: com.android.systemui:id/key_enter Action : Click
Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%err Error Code Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%errmsg Error Message Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1></StringArray>

Action.label: Effectively splits the Password on each digit, creating an array of digits.
Loop through the digits and click each one.

Vals.com.twofortyfouram.locale.intent.extra.B: Type: Id Value: com.android.systemui:id/key%digit Action : Click

Action.label: If the screen is off, turn it on.

Coordinates are passed as a comma delimited string using this pattern: X,Y1,Y2.

Y1 doesn't need to be smaller than Y2. If Y1 is larger, Tasker will swipe up; else it will swipe down.

Vals.com.twofortyfouram.locale.intent.extra.B: Gesture Type: Swipe Manage Accessibility Service: Unchanged Start Point: %coord1 End Point: %coord2 Duration: %duration
Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%err Error Code Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%errmsg Error Message Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1></StringArray>

Action.label:
Coordinates are passed as a comma delimited string using this pattern: X1,X2,Y.

X1 doesn't need to be smaller than X2. If X1 is larger, Tasker will swipe left; else it will swipe right.

Vals.com.twofortyfouram.locale.intent.extra.B: Gesture Type: Swipe Start Point: %coord1 End Point: %coord2 Duration: %duration
Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%err Error Code Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%errmsg Error Message Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1></StringArray>

Action.label:
Wait for a number of seconds (%par2) and milliseconds (%par1) as specified by the caller.

If no arguments are provided, we wait for 1s. If only one argument is provided, we will use that in combination with the default set for the other.

Dwell time defaults to 1s 0ms, and is passed in as "s|ms". The pipe character separating the two values is important!
The number of loops to perform defaults to 1.
Simple loops of 1s duration can be performed by passing in only the number of loops.
